content.location: 40-50 feet right of Taco Time, behind a tree.

content.description: Serious climbing for the grade.  It would be unpleasant to fall on many parts of this route due to the nature of the fall that would result (i.e. it wouldn't be a clean fall).  Crux is near the top.  It was a very enjoyable climb and is an easy way to get to the top of this wall if you intend to TR some of the other climbs.
content.location: Farthest right bolted climb above a knobby stump.  Right of Atomic Cafe.  Rap down off of anchors.

content.description: Climb the large flake, left of Taco Time.  Fun easy route.  Protection IMO, is just "ok."
content.protection: Trad route, stoppers and cams up to 2''
content.location: The large flake, left of Taco Time.

content.description: Face climb at 30-degree traverse left towards an arete that is 7ft to the right of Taco Time's top anchor. The climb start easy 5.4, then becomes 5.5, 5.6, 5.7, etc. till at the arete 5.9. Thus the name of the route. There's a jug on top of the arete -- reach to it is the crux. Top off from the jug or traverse left to the double-bolt top anchor of Taco Time. The route is full of lichen and absolutely no chalk mark -- indication of no traffic so far. To top belay or top rope, try not to use the trees 20-30 ft back from the edge. There's a rock horn on the ground 15 ft back that you can loop you rope on it.
content.protection: So far we (Gardner Hui and Kevin Earl) only top roped the route. There's hardly places for the pros. We'll go back to check when we have times.
content.location:
First locate Taco Time -- it start at the left side of a boulder with a line of bolts going up. Walk around the boulder. The Increasing Grade start from the right side of the boulder. There's a big and a small tree there. Start right of the trees as well to prevent damaging them. 

  Either rap down the double-bolt top anchor from Taco Time, or hike down from the left side of the wall.

content.description: Work up the first two bolts on Blockade.  Then work left across a ledge type hold to find a vertical crack that leads to the top.
Climb up and left through the steep section on sidepulls and blocks.
content.location: On the far left of the meadows, depending on the year your belayers could  be wet.

content.description:
A slightly scary route. The first part is protected by bolts but once you hit the crux you risk a good size fall onto a protruding ledge. The top is runout. Needs a bolt or two added/moved to make it a great route. Top anchors supplied by PH and installed by AG Nov '06 (note: permit-approved anchors) 

  Right of Barter Town, left of Atomic Cafe and Taco Time
The climbing gets harder the higher you ascend.  First bolt is a bit high and tricky to get to, but not terrible.
content.protection: Quickdraws.  Two bolt anchor on main wall with FIXE ring anchors (good).  Can't reach these bolts from the top unless you rap down to them.  Hanging belay.  This route does not top out.
content.location: Starts just left of Atomic Cafe (right arching 5.8 crack).  Follows the bolted line under a small roof and then over the roof onto the edging / crimping face and pretty much straight up.

content.description: The right arching crack.  Sustained 5.8 climbing.  No pro is available until 10-12' off the deck and the start is probably slightly above 5.8 (imho).
content.protection: Nuts, tricams, cams to 2" (I think, been a while).  Can setup a belay on a tree about 30' back from the top.  Use the Taco Time anchors to double rap down.
content.location: Left of Taco Time (the rightmost 5.6 bolted line). Probably about 15' left.  Right of barter town (bolted route going left  under the roof)

content.description: The main wall, synonymous with the larger Meadows region which includes other formations.
